Then some of them said to others: 'Guard him now until the morning comes.' When the morning came, I rode my animal.

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Busayr: My mother said to my father: If I prepared food for the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and invited him, he would come. So we did. We prepared thareed (bread soaked in broth) with butter for him. Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ came and entered the house. My mother placed a thin blanket for him, and I gathered it to make it more comfortable for him. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sat on it, and we placed water before him. He said: 'Take with the name of Allah' and pointed with his three fingers to the top of it. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ finished, we said: 'O Messenger of Allah, invoke Allah for us.' He said: 'O Allah, forgive them, be merciful to them, and bless them in their provision.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Busayr al-Mazini: Two Bedouins came to the Prophet ﷺ. One of them said: 'O Messenger of Allah, which of the people is best?' He said: 'Glad tidings to the one whose life is long and whose deeds are good.' The other said: 'Which deed is best?' He said: 'That you depart from this world while your tongue is moist with the remembrance of Allah the Mighty and Majestic.' He said: 'O Messenger of Allah, is that sufficient for me?' He said: 'Yes, and it is more than sufficient for you.'
